intro: Seseli campestre, commonly known as field seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided, feathery lobes. Seseli campestre is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
